shortIntro.title: What This Game Needs to Run Smoothly
shortIntro.para1: Genshin Impact is one of the most visually impressive and open-world action RPGs available on mobile. Because of its massive map, high-quality textures, particle effects and heavy combat animations, the game requires a decent device to run smoothly without lag.
shortIntro.para2: Low-end devices can play the game at lowest graphics with reduced render distance, while mid-range and flagship phones deliver 40–60 FPS with much higher visual quality. Keeping enough free storage and good thermals is also important to maintain stable performance.

intro: Below are the verified minimum and recommended specifications your Android phone should meet to run Genshin Impact with stable FPS and smooth exploration across Teyvat.

minimum.CPU: Snapdragon 660 / Kirin 710 / Helio P60 or equivalent
minimum.Storage: At least 20GB free space (required for full game files)
minimum.Internet: Stable 4G or WiFi connection for co-op and live events

recommended.Internet: Low-latency broadband or stable 5G/4G for best co-op experience

ios_intro: iOS devices must meet the following requirements to run Genshin Impact smoothly, especially during busy combat, gliding, and elemental reaction-heavy scenes.
fps_intro: Genshin Impact’s FPS performance changes a lot depending on device temperature, graphics settings, and map area (forest, Sumeru, Fontaine, etc.). Below is the general expected FPS range for different categories of mobile devices.

fps_list.fps: 45–60 FPS (with motion blur and shadows ON)

faqIntroText: Here are the most helpful and commonly asked questions regarding Genshin Impact’s device performance and FPS settings.

faqList.question: Is Genshin Impact heavy on mobile?
faqList.answer: Yes. Due to its open-world design and high-quality assets, it demands strong CPU and GPU performance.

faqList.question: Can I run Genshin Impact on 3GB RAM?
faqList.answer: Yes, but expect frequent loading delays and lower graphic settings. Clearing background apps helps.

faqList.question: Does Genshin Impact support 60 FPS on all devices?
faqList.answer: 60 FPS mode appears on many devices, but only mid-range and flagship phones maintain stable 60 FPS.
